info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 11:42PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN BEAVER... SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER AND NORTH CENTRAL ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Brighton, or over Beaver Falls, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Economy, Ambridge, New Brighton, Beaver, Baden, Rochester, Harmony Township, Seven Fields, Patterson Township, Conway, Big Beaver, Freedom, Bell Acres, West Mayfield, Bridgewater, and Patterson Heights. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 14 and 29. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 78 and 83. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 30 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
